Patent Information.Patent Title: Antimicrobial peptides and methods of identifying the same.
Patent Information.Abstract: Antimicrobial peptides and methods of identifying the same are provided.

Sequence Information.Peptide Name: LL-37(17-32)(C-terminal fragment of LL-37; Human, mammals, animals)
Sequence Information.Target Organism: Gram-negative bacteria:Escherichia coli K12(MIC=20 µM).Drug-resistant KBv cancer cells (LC50=30 µM), Drug-sensitive KB cancer cells (LC50=30 µM).
Sequence Information.Hemolytic Activity: No hemolysis information or data found in the reference(s) presented in this entry
Sequence Information.Structure Description: To achieve selective membrane targeting, D-amino acids were incorporated into LL-37(17-32). The D-peptide showed similar antibacterial activity to the L-diastereomer, it lost toxicity to human cells.
Sequence Information.Comments: Antibacterial and anticancer assays found that LL-37(17-32) was more active than LL-37(13-37).

Literature.Title: Solution structures of human LL-37 fragments and NMR-based identification of a minimal membrane-targeting antimicrobial and anticancer region.
Literature.Author: Li X, Li Y, Han H, Miller DW, Wang G.
